case_vignette: A 21-year-old female is brought to the emergency department by her roommate. Her roommate says that the patient has been acting “strangely” for the past 10 days. She has noticed that the patient has been moving and talking on the phone at all hours of the night. She doesn’t think that the patient sleeps more than one to two hours a night. She also spends hours pacing up and down the apartment, talking about “trying to save the world.” She also notices that the patient has been speaking very fast. When asking the patient if anything seems different, the patient denies anything wrong, only adding that, “she’s made great progress on her plans." The patient said she has felt like this on one occasion 2 years ago, and she recalled being hospitalized for about 2 weeks. She denies any history of depression, although she said about a year ago she had no energy and had a hard time motivating herself to go to class and see her friends for months. She denies hearing any voices or any visual hallucinations.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been very active, barely sleeping one to two hours a night, and I've been talking and moving around a lot, especially late at night.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been acting like this for the past 10 days.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any mental health conditions in the past?
Yes, I was hospitalized for something similar 2 years ago.
Do you currently take any medications for mental health conditions? If so, what are they?
I didn't mention taking any medications for mental health conditions.
Do you have any family history of mental health conditions?
I haven't said anything about my family's health history.
I apologize for the misunderstanding. Given your symptoms and history, it seems like you might be experiencing a manic episode. Have you ever been diagnosed with bipolar disorder?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with bipolar disorder, as far as I've mentioned.
Got it. I apologize if I made any assumptions. Do you have a history of any mental health conditions in your family?
I didn't provide any information about my family's mental health history.

Got it. Thank you for your patience. Based on your symptoms and history of previous hospitalization for similar symptoms, it's possible you may be experiencing a manic episode associated with bipolar disorder.

**Final Diagnosis:** Possible manic episode associated with bipolar disorder
